title: how to play .imf file extensions
content: What do I need for .imf files? any links would be ideal.- .... . <> ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . <> .. ... <> - --- .- ... -

title: Re: how to play .imf file extensions
content:
Winamp and the adplug plugin: [url=http://adplug.sourceforge.net/]adplug.sourceforge.net/[/url]

After installing the plugin in Winamp, you can use Winamp to play .IMF files.

title: Re: how to play .imf file extensions
content:
Do i put the plugin in the directory of winamp? But then how do i install?
And which one do I need? adplug-2.0.1.tar.bz2 or adplug-2.0.1.tar.gz?- .... . <> ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . <> .. ... <> - --- .- ... -

title: Re: how to play .imf file extensions
content: Unless you're running Linux, FreeBSD, etc. then neither.  Follow the links to the [url=http://www.informatik.uni-oldenburg.de/~dyna/adplug/]Windows version[/url], download the latest .zip and unzip it into the Winamp plugins folder (there's a readme in the .zip if you get lost.)

title: Re: how to play .imf file extensions
content: You can download AdPlay from the same site, that's a DOS-based equivalent to Winamp+Adplug, which will run in DOSBox too, but that's the only alternative I'm aware of.

title: re:
content:
Damn... I switched to foobar2000 a while back, and now it looks like I'm going to have to keep winamp around just for this. Bah.

edit: Oooh, the newest version can finally play most (all?) IMFs at the right speed [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
edit 2: Nope, only most. Still more than the older version I had though.

title: IMF playback speed
content:
Oh, my patches have been included now, I didn't notice - all you have to do to get files to play at the correct speed is rename them. If they play too fast, rename them to .wlf (instead of .imf) and if they play too slowly rename them to .imf. This makes it possible to play every single IMF file I'm aware of at the correct speed *except* Duke Nukem II, but those IMFs are supported by the AdPlug database so they should play fine (if not I've got tweaked versions that run at proper IMF speed.)

In case you're wondering what the correct speed is, here's a short list:

.IMF: Bio Menace, Cosmo, Keen, Major Stryker, Monster Bash
.WLF: Anything based on the Wolf3D engine (Blake Stone, Body Count, etc.)

title: Re: IMF playback speed
content:
